contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox spaceflight | name = Xatcobeo | image = | image_caption = | mission_type = | operator = | website = | COSPAR_ID = | SATCAT = | mission_duration = | spacecraft_type = [[CubeSat]] | spacecraft_bus = | manufacturer = | dry_mass = | launch_mass = | power = | launch_date = {{start-date|February 13, 2012}} | launch_rocket = [[Vega (rocket)|Vega]] | launch_site = [[Guiana Space Centre|Kourou]] [[ELA-1]] | launch_contractor = [[Arianespace]] | last_contact = <!-- {{end-date|[insert date here]}} --> | decay_date = | orbit_epoch = | orbit_reference = [[geocentric orbit|Geocentric]] | orbit_regime = [[Low Earth orbit|Low Earth]] | orbit_periapsis = | orbit_apoapsis = | orbit_inclination = | orbit_period = | apsis = gee }} '''Xatcobeo''', originally known as ''Dieste'', is a project to build the first [[Galicia (Spain)|Galician]] [[artificial satellite]]<ref name="PROGRESO">{{cite news |title= La Agencia Espacial Europea pondrá en órbita el primer satélite gallego|author= |newspaper= El Progreso|date= june 5, 2008|url= http://elprogreso.galiciae.com/nova/12054.html|accessdate= november 17, 2009}}</ref> developed by a team from various departments of the [[University of Vigo]] and leadered by Fernando Aguado<ref>{{cite news |title= A Axencia Espacial Europea aproba o proxecto elaborado pola Universidade e INTA para desenvolver un satélite de uso científico|author= |newspaper= Diario da Universidade de Vigo|date= june 5, 2008|url= http://duvi.uvigo.es/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=1218&Itemid=2|accessdate= november 17, 2009}}</ref> in collaboration with the [[Instituto Nacional de Técnica Aeroespacial]] (INTA) and with the support of the Galician [[government-owned corporation]] [[Retegal]]. The project was presented to the [[European Space Agency]] for its launch in the inaugural flight of the [[Vega (rocket)|Vega rocket]] from the [[Guiana Space Centre]], in [[Kourou]] ([[French Guiana]]). Its life will be between 6 and 12 months, and its cost will be around 1.2 million [[euro]]s, being 50% funded by the Ministerio de Ciencia e Investigación of [[Spain]], 25% by Retegal and in the last 25% jointly by the University of Vigo and INTA.<ref>{{cite news |title= O satélite galego chamarase 'Xatcobeo'|author= |newspaper= A NOSA TERRA DIARIO|date= june 19, 2008|url= http://www.anosaterra.org/nova/o-satlite-galego-chamarase-xatcobeo-.html|accessdate= november 17, 2009}}</ref> It is a [[Cubesat]]-type satellite and its objective will be to do research related with [[communication]]s and with [[solar power]] in satellites.<ref name="PROGRESO"/> == See also == *[[List of CubeSats]] == External links == *[http://www.xatcobeo.com/cms/index.php Xatcobeo Web] * [http://www.tsc.uvigo.es/ Department of Signal Theory and Communications (TSC) Web] * [http://lia.ei.uvigo.es/ Laboratory of Applied Computer Science (LIA) Web] <ref>[http://lia.ei.uvigo.es/projects/xatcobeo/index.html Xatcobeo section in LIA], march 11, 2010</ref><ref>[http://www.inta.es/noticiaintaenprensa.aspx?Id=95129 INTA in press], november 22, 2009</ref><ref>[http://www.laregion.es/noticia.php?id=109817 La Región], november 22, 2009</ref> * [http://www.inta.es/ National Institute of Aerospace Technology (INTA) Web] * [http://teleco.uvigo.es/ Superior Technical School of Telecommunication Engineering Web] * [http://esei.uvigo.es/ Superior Technical School of Computer Science Engineering Web] * [http://www.uvigo.es/ University of Vigo Web] == References == <references /> {{Orbital launches in 2012}} [[Category:Science and technology in Galicia]] [[Category:Student satellites]] [[Category:CubeSats]] [[Category:Space program of Spain]]
